metadata.title: Enterprise Logging and Auditing System Security Plan

information-types.name: System and Network Monitoring
information-types.description: This system maintains historical logging and auditing information for all client devices connected to this system.

status.remarks: This is an example, and is not intended to be implemented as a system

component-logging-policy.name: Enterprise Logging, Monitoring, and Alerting Policy
component-logging-policy.description:
Requires all components to send logs to the enterprise logging solution
— Requires all components synchronize their time with the appropriate enterprise time service, and at what frequency.
— Identifies the events that must be captured
— Identifies who is responsible/accountable for performing these functions

system-integration-process.name: System Integration Process
system-integration-process.description: Ensures proper integration into the enterprise as new systems are brought into production.

component-logging-policy.remarks:
Ensures logs from components in new system are able to reach Splunk

Ensures log monitoring capabilities recognize new system as authorized.

inventory-management-process.name: Inventory Management Process
inventory-management-process.description: Describes how new components are introduced into the system - ensures monitoring teams know about every asset that should be producing logs, thus should be monitored.

component-logging-policy.remarks: Describes how new components are introduced into the system - ensures monitoring teams know about every asset that should be producing logs, thus should be monitored.

configuration-management-guidance.name: Configuration Management
configuration-management-guidance.description: Describes how to configure a component to ensure its logs are transmitted to Splunk in the appropriate format. Also describes how to configure time synchronization.

component-logging-policy.remarks: Describes how to configure a component to ensure its logs are transmitted to Splunk in the appropriate format. Also describes how to configure time synchronization.

log-review-process.name: Log Review Process
log-review-process.description: Describes how and when security administrators should review audit logs, and describes how to escalate suspected or actual issues discovered as a result of the review.

monitoring-and-alerting-process.name: Monitoring and Alerting Process
monitoring-and-alerting-process.description: Describes how security operations center (SOC) staff operates automated log analysis and alerting systems, including validation of alerts received, and tuning of automated monitoring capabilities. This also describes how how to escalate suspected or actual issues discovered as a result of alerts received.

capability-enterprise-logging-and-auditi.name: Enterprise Logging and Auditing Capability
capability-enterprise-logging-and-auditi.description: This capability provides an auditing and logging solution for an organization. Every system within the organization leverages this capability to satisfy auditing and logging requirements.
